page.title: 05PRIMARY SCHOOL CHEADLE
page.content: MY DAY AT A CHEADLE PRIMARY SCHOOL. AFTER REGISTRATION IT IS INTO THE HALL FOR HYMN PRACTICE.I ARRIVE BACK AT ABOUT 9.45 AM AND DO MY MATHS, MY FAVOURITE SUBJECT. AFTER 45 MINUTES THE BELL GOES. I GO OUTSIDE AND PLAY KICKSTONE. AT 1O.45 BREAK ENDS. IT IS ENGLISH NEXT MY WORST SUBJECT. AFTER AN HOUR OF ADJECTIVES, NOUNS AND VERBS THE BELL FINALLY RINGS. I GO INTO THE CANTEEN AND EAT MY PACKED LUNCH. AFTER LUNCH I PLAY ROUNDERS UNTIL ONE O CLOCK. WHEN I GO BACK IT IS TIME FOR READING WHICH I LIKE. AFTER READING I USUALLY DO TOPIC WORK OR GEOGRAPHY UNTIL BREAK AT 2.3OPM. AFTER BREAK OUR TEACHER READS TO US. THE CLASS READER AT THE MOMENT IS THE GHOST OF THOMAS KEMPE, BY PENELOPE LIVELY. I AM ELEVEN YEARS OLD, CALLED LISA AND GO TO GATLEY PRIMARY SCHOOL.
